result.execSummary:
The defendant John J. Hess was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

(3:28 PM cases 15CF1020, 15CF1144, 16CF207, 16CF782 called.) Prosecuting attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant John J. Hess in court, in custody. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for John J. Hess.
Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Defendant pleads No Contest to 15CF1020 Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine as Party to a Crime, 15CF1144 Count 1: Felony Bail Jumping and 16CF207 Count 1: Felony Bail Jumping.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest pleas and finds the defendant Guilty of 15CF1020 Count 1, 15CF1144 Count 1 and 16CF207 Count 1.

Court imposes and stays a sentence of 9 months jail with Huber privileges on each count concurrent.
Court places the defendant on probation for 18 months on each count concurrent with the following privileges:
60 days jail with Huber privileges, stayed pending further order of the Court on 15CF1020 Count 1. AODA and follow through with recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with G.H., A.C. No contact with any known drug dealers/users, except in a therapeutic setting. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs to include 1 bench warrant fee in 15CF1020. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Court orders 82 days sentence credit on 15CF1020, 79 days sentence credit on 15CF1144 and 79 days sentence credit on 16CF207. Any remaining charges including case 16CF782 are dismissed and read in.

(Cases called at 2:14 PM  - 15CF1020, 15CF1144, 16CF207, 16CF782)
Defendant John J. Hess appeared by video, in custody from the Chippewa County Jail, without counsel.  Attorney Robert Stoiber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
State advises that an initial appearance is needed on 16CF782.  Court indicates that will not be able to occur today and bail only will be addressed.  State requests $10,000 cash bond.  Defendant makes a statement.  Court orders a $10,000 cash bond to cover all 4 cases.  Condition of bond includes: no use or possession of any illegal substances.  
Initial Appearance/Hearing: February 23, 2022 at 11:00 AM (Defendant will appear from Chippewa County Jail)
